project.description: A project name which uniquely identifies this project

links.description: requirements for describing links in the `facility` section of a project card.
links.title: Roadway selection properties

nodes.description: requirements for describing multiple nodes of a project card (e.g. to delete).
nodes.title: Roadway network node

node.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

bearing.description: The angle of the eminating arc from the point, expressed in clockwise degrees from North (0)

name.description: Name of Roadway facility. If multiple, can be contatenated with a comma.

ref.description: Reference name of roadway, per Open Street Map definition.

osm_link_id.description: Reference to the corresponding Open Street Map link. Note that due to link splitting this may or may not be unique, and is not a required attribute.

roadway.description: Roadway type, using [OSM Highway values](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:highway#Roads). Notes: * `X_link` roadway types denote linkage roads going to/from roadway type X (i.e. on/off ramps, etc). * `road` denotes unknown type.

bearing.description: The angle of the eminating arc from the point, expressed in clockwise degrees from North (0)

lanes.description: Number of lanes either in simple or complex terms.

ML_lanes.description: Number of lanes either in simple or complex terms.

price.description: Price of facility, either as a positive number of a complex type by time of day and/or access category.

ML_price.description: Price of facility, either as a positive number of a complex type by time of day and/or access category.

walk_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for pedestrians. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bike_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for cyclists. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bike_facility.description: Indicator for the category of bicycle facility on or along the roadway. If null, indicates unknown. If zero, indicates no facility.

drive_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for driving. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bus_only.description: Indicates if a facility is rail-only if True.  Must not be true if any of walk_access, bike_access, drive_access, rail_only are True.

rail_only.description: Indicates if a facility is rail-only if True.  Must not be true if any of walk_access, bike_access, drive_access, bus_only are True.

segment_id.description: An identifier for segments of roadway. Can be useful for querying and setting values for parts of facilities, summary scripts, etc.

items.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

ML_access.description: Indicates where a managed lane facility can by accessed either by indicating `all` for everywhere, or listing foreign keys to specific A-nodes.

items.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

ML_egress.description: Indicates where a managed lane facility can by accessed either by indicating `all` for everywhere, or listing foreign keys to specific A-nodes.

A.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

B.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

osm_link_id.description: Reference to the corresponding Open Street Map link. Note that due to link splitting this may or may not be unique, and is not a required attribute.

bearing.description: The angle of the eminating arc from the point, expressed in clockwise degrees from North (0)

ref.description: Reference name of roadway, per Open Street Map definition.

roadway.description: Roadway type, using [OSM Highway values](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:highway#Roads). Notes: * `X_link` roadway types denote linkage roads going to/from roadway type X (i.e. on/off ramps, etc). * `road` denotes unknown type.

items.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

items.description: Foreign key to the nodes object.

ML_egress.description: Indicates where a managed lane facility can by accessed either by indicating `all` for everywhere, or listing foreign keys to specific A-nodes.

walk_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for pedestrians. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bike_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for cyclists. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bike_facility.description: Indicator for the category of bicycle facility on or along the roadway. If null, indicates unknown. If zero, indicates no facility.

drive_access.description: Indicates if a facility is generally available for driving. Must not be true if any of bus_only or rail_only are true.

bus_only.description: Indicates if a facility is rail-only if True.  Must not be true if any of walk_access, bike_access, drive_access, rail_only are True.

rail_only.description: Indicates if a facility is rail-only if True.  Must not be true if any of walk_access, bike_access, drive_access, bus_only are True.

segment_id.description: An identifier for segments of roadway. Can be useful for querying and setting values for parts of facilities, summary scripts, etc.

model_node_id.description: Primary key to the nodes object.

osm_node_id.description: Reference to the corresponding Open Street Map node.

walk_node.description: Indicates node is part of the pedestrian network. Useful for exporting or querying networks by mode.

bike_node.description: Indicates node is part of the bike network. Useful for exporting or querying networks by mode.

drive_node.description: Indicates node is part of the driving network. Useful for exporting or querying networks by mode.

transit_node.description: Indicates node is part of the transit network. Useful for exporting or querying networks by mode.

N.description: Price of facility, either as a positive number of a complex type by time of day and/or access category.

bearing.description: The angle of the eminating arc from the point, expressed in clockwise degrees from North (0)

transit_node.description: Number of lanes either in simple or complex terms.
